about.title: About Me
about.intro: I'm Juan Diego Gómez, a Spanish Corporate Trainer with more than 10 years of experience teaching executives, managers, teams, and international professionals from Europe, the U.S., and Latin America.
about.background: Before becoming a full-time language trainer, I earned a degree in Mechanical Engineering, which strongly influences the way I teach today. This background helps me break down complex concepts into clear, simple, and tangible explanations — something my students value, especially when dealing with advanced grammar or abstract communication skills.
about.approach: My approach combines clear structure, real corporate scenarios, and personalized communication coaching.
about.experience: My experience learning multiple languages allows me to identify patterns, anticipate difficulties, and help students progress faster with strategies that actually work in real conversations and professional environments.

items.name: Silvia Andrade
items.text: Taking classes with Juan Diego to improve my language skills has been one of the best decisions I've made at this point in my life. The support, the dynamic of the classes, the availability of schedules, the guides we've worked with—all of this together has allowed me to get closer and closer to achieving my goal.

items.name: Lina Rodriguez
items.text:
I want to express how much I enjoy my lessons with Juan Diego. I especially like that he covers all aspects of the language: grammar, pronunciation, reading, and writing, adapting to each student's weaknesses and needs. This makes his classes very personalized and effective.

I also appreciate how you focus on what I like and what I need for my career. Thanks to this, I learn in a more motivating and meaningful way, because everything you teach is aligned with my interests and professional goals.

I also appreciate that he emphasizes speaking practice: he gives us many opportunities to converse and improve our fluency, which strengthens our confidence when speaking and allows us to apply grammar and pronunciation in real situations.

In short, his classes are comprehensive, flexible, student-centered, and very practical in terms of conversation. I really appreciate his dedication and the quality of his teaching!

items.name: Jhonatan Coy
items.text: The classes with Profe-Chill are exceptional, tailored to what you want to improve, and with a very pleasant atmosphere that helps you relax and learn in the best way possible, without pressure and always striving to improve.

items.name: German Lancheros
items.text: My name is Germán. At 75 years old, as we were planning a trip to visit our daughter, I wanted to improve my English. A friend recommended Professor Diego, and after 36 personalized lessons, I am now in Melbourne and have been able to socialize with my family in English. When I return to Colombia, I will continue my classes to keep improving my conversation skills. Thank you, Professor.

items.name: David Calderon
items.text:
I took personalized English classes with Juan Diego, Profe Chill, and from the start they felt different. The classes are completely tailored to you, without pressure and with plenty of space to converse. It’s not the typical textbook-and-rules approach all the time, but learning by using the language for real.

A large part of the classes is based on conversation, which was key for me. Gradually, I lost my fear and embarrassment when speaking, understanding that making mistakes is part of the process. That confidence grew class after class, and today I can communicate with much more ease.

This process allowed me to move easily abroad during work trips and feel much more comfortable speaking with people in my professional environment, where English is often indispensable. Now conversations don't feel forced or stressful, but natural.

Juan Diego has a very calm way of teaching; he listens, adapts the classes based on what he notices, and makes the learning flow. More than studying English, I felt I was practicing for real life.
